Others: The Pakistan vs New Zealand t20 series is set to take place on April 18th, 2024 in Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium. The series will consist of five matches.
The series will be the second successive white-ball tour of New Zealand to Pakistan.
The series will serve as an ideal preparation for both teams before the t20 World Cup to be hosted in the USA in June 2024.
There are several surprises and setbacks for both teams in the series.
Shaheen Afridi has been replaced as captain for Pakistan due to poor performances.
Babar Azam has returned as captain for Pakistan under the new management.
Muhammad Amir and Imad Wasim have returned to the Pakistan team after a long gap.
New Zealand will miss key players such as Kane Williamson, Devon Conway, Daryl Mitchell, Rachin Ravindra, Mitchell Santner, Lockie Ferguson, Trent Boult, and Glenn Philipps due to IPL commitments.
Will Young, Tom Latham, and Tim Southee will not play for New Zealand due to personal reasons.
Michael Bracewell has been appointed captain of the New Zealand team for the series.
The series schedule includes five matches, with the first two matches taking place in Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium and the remaining three matches in Gaddafi Stadium Lahore.
The series is expected to be exciting for cricket lovers from Pakistan and around the world.
